summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein case, sent on June 19, 2008. It outlines the federal position on the non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein, stating that the federal investigation will end if Epstein abides by the agreement, which requires him to plead guilty to state charges. It also mentions a conversation with defense attorney Roy Black.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Mentioned as having spoken with the email sender regarding the Epstein case, inquiring about resolving federal and state litigation simultaneously.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case and the non-prosecution agreement. The email details the requirements for him under the agreement, including pleading guilty to state charges.

connections.description: Roy Black is acting as defense counsel for Jeffrey Epstein, as indicated by his inquiries about resolving the litigation.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney is representing the federal government's position in the non-prosecution agreement with Epstein.

events.title: Conversation with Roy Black
events.description: The email sender and another person spoke with defense attorney Roy Black regarding the Epstein case and the possibility of resolving federal and state litigation simultaneously.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The federal non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein requires him to plead guilty to the existing state indictment and to a state information charging procuring minors for prostitution.
The agreement mandates at least 18 months imprisonment and allows victims to pursue damages as if Epstein had been convicted of federal offenses.
The federal investigation will end if Epstein abides by the non-prosecution agreement; pursuing a different state plea would be considered a breach.
The email reveals internal communication about wrapping up the case before the recipient's retirement.
